Class AbstractTurtle

java.lang.Object
  AbstractTurtle
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Turtle
public abstract class AbstractTurtle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Turtle, java.lang.Cloneable

A utility implementation of the Turtle interface, giving a reasonable implementation for all other methods than move.

Author:
Ilkka Kokkarinen

Field Summary
protected  java.awt.Color color
          The current drawing colour of this turtle.

          The current state of the turtle pen.

          The Graphics2D object that the turtle draws on.

          The current absolute heading of the turtle.
protected  java.util.Stack<java.lang.Double> store
          The internal stack that the turtle can push and pop its positions.

          The current stroke used by this turtle for drawing.
protected  double x
          The x-coordinate of the current position of the turtle.
protected  double y
          The y-coordinate of the current position of the turtle.

popState

public void popState()
Pop the previous state of the turtle (containing the absolute position and the absolute heading) from the internal stack, making the turtle to return to that position.

setHeading

public void setHeading(double angle)
Set the absolute heading of the turtle. The spirit of turtle graphics is to call this method only once in the beginning, after which you only use the relative motion operations.

Specified by:
setHeading in interface Turtle
Parameters:
angle - The absolute heading angle of the turtle, expressed in degrees with 0 pointing right and 90 pointing up.

setPen

public void setPen(boolean down)
Set the state of the pen. When the pen is down, the turtle leaves some kind of drawing behind its movement, and when the pen is up, the turtle moves without drawing anything.

Specified by:
setPen in interface Turtle
Parameters:
down - Whether the pen is currently down.

setPosition

public void setPosition(double x,
                        double y)
Set the absolute position of the turtle. The spirit of turtle graphics is to call this method only once in the beginning, after which you only use the relative motion operations.

Specified by:
setPosition in interface Turtle
Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of the absolute position.
y - The y-coordinate of the absolute position.

setStroke

public void setStroke(java.awt.Stroke stroke)
Set the current stroke to be used in drawing when the pen is down.

Specified by:
setStroke in interface Turtle
Parameters:
stroke - The current stroke to use in drawing.

turn

public void turn(double turnAngle)
Turn the turtle in place the given angle, measured in degrees. Positive angle turns the turtle left, while a negative angle turns it right.

Specified by:
turn in interface Turtle
Parameters:
turnAngle - The angle to turn.
